pullRequest.title: Implement basic badges
pullRequest.bodyText: When displaying an unwatched count, it currently is off-center to the left :/

commit.message: Don't include font-padding on badge counter

nodes.bodyText: The text alignment doesn't do anything because the view is as wide as the text
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@

+    android:textAlignment="center"

+    tools:layout_width="32dp">
+

+        android:id="@+id/badge_background"
+        android:layout_width="match_parent"
+        android:layout_height="match_parent"
+        android:src="@drawable/circle_accent"
+        android:visibility="gone"
+        app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"
+        app:layout_constraintLeft_toLeftOf="parent"
+        app:layout_constraintRight_toRightOf="parent"
+        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent"
+        tools:visibility="visible"/>
+
+    <TextView
+        android:id="@+id/badge_counter"
+        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
+        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
+        android:foregroundGravity="center"
+        android:gravity="center"
+        android:textAlignment="center"

nodes.bodyText: Because everything is literally stacked on top of each other it might be better to use a FrameLayout. Makes rendering a bit faster too.
This function accepts a nullable but when called always supplies a non-null item.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
+package org.jellyfin.androidtv.ui
+
+import android.content.Context
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.View
+import androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout
+import kotlinx.android.synthetic.main.badge_watched.view.*
+import org.jellyfin.androidtv.R
+import org.jellyfin.androidtv.model.itemtypes.PlayableItem
+
+class WatchedBadge(context: Context) : ConstraintLayout(context) {
+	private var item: PlayableItem? = null
+
+	private val changeListener: () -> Unit = {
+		setItemData(item)
+	}
+
+	init {
+		val inflater = LayoutInflater.from(context)
+		inflater.inflate(R.layout.badge_watched, this)
+	}
+
+	constructor(context: Context, item: PlayableItem) : this(context) {
+		this.item = item
+		setItemData(item)
+	}
+
+	fun setWatched() {
+		badge_background.visibility = View.VISIBLE
+		badge_watched_tick.visibility = View.VISIBLE
+		badge_counter.visibility = View.GONE
+	}
+
+	fun setRemainingCount(count: Int) {
+		badge_background.visibility = View.VISIBLE
+		badge_watched_tick.visibility = View.GONE
+		badge_counter.visibility = View.VISIBLE
+		badge_counter.text = count.toString()
+	}
+
+	fun clear() {
+		badge_background.visibility = View.GONE
+		badge_watched_tick.visibility = View.GONE
+		badge_counter.visibility = View.GONE
+	}
+
+	private fun setItemData(item: PlayableItem?) {

nodes.bodyText: Might be a bit late but i'd swap the parameter so you specify the location first and the content second

nodes.bodyText: If you specify the primary constructor as (context: Context, private var item: PlayableItem? = null) it will be a class property with a value of null by default.

nodes.bodyText: You can add a line here like item?.let(::setItemData) to update if you go for the primary constructor change. Could remove the secondary constructor entirely in that case.

@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
+package org.jellyfin.androidtv.ui
+
+import android.content.Context
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.View
+import android.widget.FrameLayout
+import kotlinx.android.synthetic.main.badge_watched.view.*
+import org.jellyfin.androidtv.R
+import org.jellyfin.androidtv.model.itemtypes.PlayableItem
+
+class WatchedBadge(context: Context) : FrameLayout(context) {
+	private var item: PlayableItem? = null
+
+	private val changeListener: () -> Unit = {
+		if (item != null) {
+			setItemData(item!!)
+		}
+	}
+
+	init {
+		val inflater = LayoutInflater.from(context)
+		inflater.inflate(R.layout.badge_watched, this)

nodes.bodyText: This constructor shouldn't be necessary because  the item parameter has a default value

@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+package org.jellyfin.androidtv.ui
+
+import android.content.Context
+import android.view.View
+import android.widget.ImageView
+import org.jellyfin.androidtv.R
+import org.jellyfin.androidtv.model.itemtypes.BaseItem
+
+class FavoriteBadge(context: Context, val item: BaseItem? = null) : ImageView(context) {
+	private val changeListener: () -> Unit = {
+		item?.let(::setItemData)
+	}
+
+	init {
+		setImageDrawable(context.getDrawable(R.drawable.ic_heart_red))
+		item?.let(::setItemData)
+	}
+
+	constructor(context: Context) : this(context, null)

nodes.bodyText: I don't think this would happen fast but if the count is higher than 99 we should probably display 99+ so the text won't overflow.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+package org.jellyfin.androidtv.ui
+
+import android.content.Context
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.View
+import android.widget.FrameLayout
+import kotlinx.android.synthetic.main.badge_watched.view.*
+import org.jellyfin.androidtv.R
+import org.jellyfin.androidtv.model.itemtypes.PlayableItem
+
+
+class WatchedBadge(context: Context, val item: PlayableItem? = null) : FrameLayout(context) {
+	private val changeListener: () -> Unit = {
+		item?.let(::setItemData)
+	}
+
+	init {
+		val inflater = LayoutInflater.from(context)
+		inflater.inflate(R.layout.badge_watched, this)
+		item?.let(::setItemData)
+	}
+

+		badge_watched_tick.visibility = View.VISIBLE
+		badge_counter.visibility = View.GONE
+	}

+	fun setRemainingCount(count: Int) {

commit.message: Watched badge now shows 99+ if it is given a count over 99
FavoriteBadge now subclasses AppCompatImageView instead of ImageView
